oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Ralph Emery On The Record with Mel Tillis - Part 2
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: Recording from Ralph Emery's (entertainer) interview of Mel Tillis (performer) for Ralph Emery: On the Record With Mel Tillis. The recording is performed in front of a live audience. The recording is from an unknown date. The tape is labeled part 2.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Ralph Emery; Mel Tillis
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: (00:00) Incoherent talking -- (00:10) Ralph Emery introduces Mel Tillis, and Emery asks Tillis about how his house had recently burned down -- (03:30) Emery reintroduces Tillis to reflect on what he lost in the fire -- (05:18) Emery inquires as to if Tillis collects his own material; additionally, Emery recalls talking to Tom T. Hall about Tillis' home -- (08:24) Emery inquires as to why Tillis elected to become a father again at his advanced age -- (09:28) Emery asks Tillis about his children and their interest in show business -- (12:55) Emery inquires about the first time Tillis was paid to perform, and Tillis reflects on his worries while performing -- (16:09) Emery praises Tillis' body of work, including Uphill All the Way, and both discuss Tillis' upcoming works -- (19:31) Tillis discusses his grueling schedule, and Emery and Tillis discuss emotions -- (20:38) Emery inquires about Tillis' patience -- (21:30) Emery inquires about Tillis' songwriting royalties, and Emery talks to Tillis about the possibility of retirement -- (26:34) Emery asks about Tillis' idea of what he's going to do for the upcoming year -- (28:38) Tillis talks about recieving cues from his band, and Tillis reflects on becoming a fireman -- (31:53) Emery and Tillis discuss how Tillis would use a train to make his way to Nashville -- (33:03) Emery and Tillis say goodbye
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Emery, Ralph; Tillis, Mel;
